SEARCH
Package com.moleculepowered.api.updater

Class Updater

java.lang.Object
com.moleculepowered.api.updater.Updater
public final class Updater extends Object

This class handles our Updater Molecule, its consists of chain methods developer's can use to customize it to their liking.

We build this component on a "provider" framework which, in other words, means that its primary function is based on providers that access the different platforms for version checking, such as Bukkit, Spigot, Github, etc.

Since:
1.0.0
Author:
OMGitzFROST

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Updater(@NotNull org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
    This constructor serves as the start of the Updater chain, its takes a plugin as its parameter that will be used to identify its current version, and provide the logging methods needed throughout this class.

    Used to return the active provider used by this updater, please note that this method has the potential of returning null, if the active provider was not set prior.

    Used to return the list of providers assigned to this updater, if no providers were given, this method will return an empty list.

    boolean
    isBetaEnabled()
    Used to return whether this updater should also notify when unstable versions are available, please note that if this method returns false, it means that release only versions will trigger notifications, and unstable versions such as BETA, ALPHA, RC will not trigger a notification.

    Used to return whether this updater is currently enabled
    void
    schedule()
    A method used to schedule the updater for execute its repeating tasks, this method is also used to verify that all requirements are met so that we can preform the update checks correctly.

    A method used to schedule the updater asynchronously to execute its repeating tasks, this method is also used to verify that all requirements are met so that we can preform the update checks correctly.

    • Updater

      public Updater(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      This constructor serves as the start of the Updater chain, its takes a plugin as its parameter that will be used to identify its current version, and provide the logging methods needed throughout this class.
      Parameters:
      plugin - Provided plugin

  • Method Details

    • schedule

      public void schedule()
      A method used to schedule the updater for execute its repeating tasks, this method is also used to verify that all requirements are met so that we can preform the update checks correctly.
      See Also:
      • scheduleAsync()

    • scheduleAsync

      public void scheduleAsync()
      A method used to schedule the updater asynchronously to execute its repeating tasks, this method is also used to verify that all requirements are met so that we can preform the update checks correctly.
      See Also:
      • schedule()

    • initialize

      public void initialize()

      A utility method that is used to centralize our version checking.

      Please note that by default this method is configured to run its tasks on the main thread, if async threading is required please consider using initialize(boolean) and define the boolean value as true.

      See Also:
      • schedule()
      • scheduleAsync()
      • initialize(boolean)

    • addProvider

      @NotNull public @NotNull Updater addProvider(@NotNull @NotNull AbstractProvider provider)

      Parameters:
      provider - an update provider
      Returns:
      an instance of this updater

    • setEnableToggle

      @NotNull public @NotNull Updater setEnableToggle(boolean enabled)
      Sets the toggle that determines whether this updater should be enabled, If the toggle is set to false, this updater will not check for new updates.
      Parameters:
      enabled - whether this updater should be enabled
      Returns:
      an instance of this updater
      See Also:
      • isEnabled()

    • setBetaToggle

      @NotNull public @NotNull Updater setBetaToggle(boolean enabled)
      Sets the toggle that determines if this updater should notify audience members of unstable builds as well, such as BETA, ALPHA, etc. If the toggle is set to false, this updater will only notify members of stable builds.
      Parameters:
      enabled - whether unstable builds are enabled
      Returns:
      an instance of this updater
      See Also:
      • isBetaEnabled()

    • setEventHandler

      @NotNull public @NotNull Updater setEventHandler(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.event.Listener listener)

      Sets the handler that will be called when an update check is completed.

      Please note that in-order for you to customize the behavior when sending notifications, your handler must include an EventHandler that listens for the UpdateCompleteEvent, otherwise this updater will provide a default handler.

      Parameters:
      listener - Designated event handler
      Returns:
      an instance of this updater

    • isBetaEnabled

      public boolean isBetaEnabled()
      Used to return whether this updater should also notify when unstable versions are available, please note that if this method returns false, it means that release only versions will trigger notifications, and unstable versions such as BETA, ALPHA, RC will not trigger a notification.
      Returns:
      true if unstable versions are enabled
      See Also:
      • setBetaToggle(boolean)

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      Used to return whether this updater is currently enabled
      Returns:
      true if enabled
      See Also:
      • setEnableToggle(boolean)

    • isAudienceMember

      public boolean isAudienceMember(@Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.OfflinePlayer player)
      Return's true if the provided player is considered an authorized audience member. Otherwise, this method will return false.
      Parameters:
      player - Target player
      Returns:
      true if player is an authorized audience member
      See Also:
      • getAudience()

    • getInterval

      public long getInterval()
      Returns the interval in which this updater will check for updates
      Returns:
      Interval in which updates will be checked.
      See Also:
      • setInterval(String)

    • setInterval

      @NotNull public @NotNull Updater setInterval(@NotNull @NotNull String input)

      Sets the interval in which this updater will check for updates

      Please take a look at the table below for examples of valid inputs.

      Unit Abbreviation
      Millisecond [ms, milli, millisecond, milliseconds]
      Second [s, sec, second, seconds]
      Minute [m, min, minute, minutes]
      Hour [h, hr, hour, hours]
      Day [d, day, days]
      Week [wk, week, weeks]
      Month [mo, month, months]
      Year [y, year, years]
      Parameters:
      input - Provided input
      Returns:
      an instance of this updater
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the input is not valid
      See Also:
      • getInterval()

    • getProvider

      @NotNull public @NotNull AbstractProvider getProvider()

    • getAudience

      public Set<org.bukkit.entity.Player> getAudience()
      Used to return a set of audience members, please note that this method, by default, features a filter to sift out offline players and retaining only those that are online. Additionally, this method will filter out those players that do not have the required permissions for receiving update information.
      Returns:
      A set of audience members that should receive notifications
      See Also:
      • isAudienceMember(OfflinePlayer)

    • getResult

      public UpdateResult getResult()
      Used to return the final result for this updater
      Returns:
      Update result
